question: What are the names of disaster projects starting later than 2022? Return None if no answer is found.
final_answer: The names of disaster projects starting later than 2022 are the Outdoor Warning Sirens project, Storm Drain Master Plan project, Guardrail Replacement Citywide project, Corral Canyon Road Bridge Repairs project, and Corral Canyon Culvert Repairs project. These projects funded through FEMA grants aim to address infrastructure damage caused by the Woolsey Fire and improve disaster preparedness in the City. If no answer is found, it will return "None."
sub_answers: The disaster projects funded through FEMA grants include the Outdoor Warning Sirens project, Storm Drain Master Plan project, Guardrail Replacement Citywide project, Corral Canyon Road Bridge Repairs project, and Corral Canyon Culvert Repairs project. The estimated completion dates for these projects vary, with some scheduled for Spring 2022 and others ongoing with updates provided to the City Council. The projects aim to address infrastructure damage caused by the Woolsey Fire and improve disaster preparedness in the City.
chunks:
Outdoor Warning Sirens (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project will be funded through a grant from FEMA
after the Wooley Fire. The project consists of hiring a consultant to develop
a plan that includes the evaluation of a siren system and possible locations.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Dependent upon final grant approval from FEMA

Storm Drain Master Plan (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project will be funded through a grant from FEMA
after the Woolsey Fire. The City will create a complete inventory of storm
drains, culverts, debris basins, manholes, and other drainage structures
within the City.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Completion Date: Spring 2022

Guardrail Replacement Citywide (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consisted of replacing the damaged

guardrail throughout the City as a result of the Woolsey Fire.

Corral Canyon Road Bridge Repairs (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consisted of replacing fire damaged existing
fencing and repairing the damaged embankment adjacent to the bridge.

Corral Canyon Culvert Repairs (FEMA Project)
sq0t1

Outdoor Warningn Sirens - Design (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: An Emergency Warning Siren system will improve the
City’s ability to alert the community by providing mechanisms to alert
residents in areas without power and those who live in neighborhoods with
poor cell service. Phase One of the project included a sound study to
determine the optimal number and locations of individual sirens, power and
infrastructure requirements, and siren sound range. The City has been

Page 7 of 8

Agenda Item # 4.A.







awarded a FEMA Hazard Mitigation grant to fund the design, engineering and
environmental compliance needed for a shovel ready project. Phase Two of
the Emergency Warning Sirens project will be implementation of the design
plan, including purchasing, installing, and testing the sirens. The City will
apply for future grant funding for this phase of the project.

(cid:190) Upates:
sq0t2

Disaster Projects (Completed)

Citywide Guardrail Replacement
Project Description: This project consisted of replacing the damaged guardrails throughout
the City caused by the Woolsey Fire on Encinal Canyon Road, Corral Canyon Road, and
Kanan Dume Road. The project was combined with the County of Los Angeles’ damaged
guardrails. The project was completed in February 2021.
